author: valentin_mihov
content: hey folks! I am looking at developing an easy hosted eth2.0 validator hosting and I am trying to figure out if there is an easy way to implement commission payments for the node operator in a trust-less way. The idea is that the node operator charges a commission on the rewards the validator node did. Do you think that will be possible? I reviewed the current testnet deposit contract and it is super simple and does not support even a simple withdrawals. is there some place where such mechanics are discussed?

author: jgm
content: <@!103095639725838336> Ethereum 2 phase 0 has no concept of transfers.  You will not be able to move funds from a validator, either deposit or rewards.

author: valentin_mihov
content: that's true. I am looking mostly in the future when the transfers will be added

author: valentin_mihov
content: I think I saw a document somewhere explaining the idea between the different actors in the staking system and there was an actor "node operator" who is able to get paid for providing hosting

author: valentin_mihov
content: but I can't find it any more. may be I was dreaming it ðŸ˜„

author: jgm
content: It's certainly a goal, but wouldn't be something we're likely to see in a generic fashion until phase 2 (when we have smart contract functionality natively on the Ethereum 2 shards)

author: valentin_mihov
content: so it is early stage WIP at the moment?

author: jgm
content: Not sure it even counts as WIP yet, to be honest

author: jgm
content: Perhaps "on the list" is a better way to put it

author: valentin_mihov
content: ok. thanks. we will think about alternative approaches then. may be something around eth1.0 subscriptions or sablier streaming
